name: Nice Backgrounds
author: brx8r

sections.description:
Manage large adaptive (mobile-ready) images and automatically apply them to areas on your WordPress site as backgrounds.
Pull beautiful photos from Unsplash using the in-built browser, or supply your own images from uploads and supplied URLs.

Usage

Once activated, go to Appearance > Nice Backgrounds. You can create one or more ‘sets’ of background images with
different settings.

Note: This plugin typically deals with resizing very large images, if you’re having problems make sure your memory limit
is sufficiently high enough to deal with some occasional heavy lifting.

Note: PNG images that are either very large or are 24-bit can be problematic. The exact details of this are yet to be
determined.

Credits

Just the other day I read a fortune cookie that said something about giving credit. I threw it away, but here is a
list of stuff I looked at to get some ideas of what to do for this plugin:

Simple Full Screen Background Image by Pippin Williamson
https://wordpress.org/plugins/simple-full-screen-background-image/

Adaptive Images for WordPress by Nevma
https://wordpress.org/plugins/adaptive-images/

Unsplash by Crew
https://unsplash.com/

Drag and Drop File Uploading by Osvaldas Valutis
https://css-tricks.com/drag-and-drop-file-uploading/

jquery-image-blob by Joe Nasca
https://github.com/CoeJoder/jquery.image.blob

Scriptaculous blog
http://www.scriptalicious.com/blog/
sections.installation:
Via WordPress:
1. Install the plugin via Plugins > Add New.
2. Activate the plugin.

By Upload:
1. Upload the nicebackgrounds folder to /wp-content/plugins/
2. Activate the plugin through the Plugins menu in WordPress
